analysis: The statement presents a causal chain (Gamma form) where not defending an area (action) is claimed to inevitably lead to being pressured to the point of no return (outcome). The lever is a causal relationship, but the argument assumes an unsupported chain of extreme consequences without justifying intermediate steps. This matches the Slippery Slope fallacy (4), as it predicts an exaggerated outcome through multiple unsupported leaps.
